meanings.definition: To make a fetish of; to regard with excessive reverence or devotion.
meanings.sent1: She was fetishizing her favorite book by reading it every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: Some people have a habit of fetishizing celebrities, forgetting they are just regular people.
meanings.sent3: He took fetishizing his lucky socks to a whole new level by framing them on his wall.
meanings.sent4: Her friends teased her for fetishizing her collection of vintage stamps.
meanings.sent5: The artist was fetishizing the color blue in all her paintings, creating a unique style.

meanings.definition: To make a fetish of; to treat with an irrational reverence or obsessive devotion.
meanings.sent1: The superstitious athlete was fetishizing his lucky socks before every game.
meanings.sent2: Some people have a tendency to fetishize material possessions, believing they bring luck.
meanings.sent3: She was caught fetishizing her coworker's new car, constantly complimenting it.
meanings.sent4: The author was fetishizing his old typewriter, refusing to write on any other device.
meanings.sent5: The chef was fetishizing his favorite knife, always keeping it sharp and clean.
